intro: Viola fukienensis, commonly known as the Chinese violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding ornamental value to gardens. Viola fukienensis is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
